name: Shawn Mendes
description:
'''Shawn Peter Raul Mendes''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|m|ɛ|n|d|ɛ|z}} {{respell|MEN|dez}}, {{IPA|pt|ˈmẽdɨʃ|lang}}; born August 8, 1998) is a Canadian singer, songwriter, and musician. He gained a following in 2013 when he posted song covers on the video-sharing platform [[Vine (software)|Vine]]. The following year, he caught the attention of artist manager [[Andrew Gertler]] and [[Island Records]] A&R Ziggy Chareton, which led to his signing a deal with the record label. Mendes's [[The Shawn Mendes EP|self-titled debut EP]] was released in 2014, followed by his debut studio album ''[[Handwritten (Shawn Mendes album)|Handwritten]]'' in 2015. ''Handwritten'' debuted atop the US [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]], making Mendes one of five artists ever to debut at number one before the age of 18. The single "[[Stitches (Shawn Mendes song)|Stitches]]" reached number one in the UK and the top 10 in the US and Canada.

Mendes's second album ''[[Illuminate (Shawn Mendes album)|Illuminate]]'' (2016) also debuted at number one in the US, with its singles "[[Treat You Better (Shawn Mendes song)|Treat You Better]]" and "[[There's Nothing Holdin' Me Back]]" reaching the top 10 in several countries. His third album [[Shawn Mendes (album)|''Shawn Mendes'']] (2018) was supported by the lead single "[[In My Blood (Shawn Mendes song)|In My Blood]]". The album's number-one debut in the US made Mendes the third-youngest artist to achieve three number-one albums. In 2019, he released the hit singles "[[If I Can't Have You (Shawn Mendes song)|If I Can't Have You]]" and "[[Señorita (Shawn Mendes and Camila Cabello song)|Señorita]]", with the latter peaking atop the US [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]]. His fourth studio album, ''[[Wonder (Shawn Mendes album)|Wonder]]'' (2020), made him the youngest male artist ever to top the ''Billboard'' 200 with four studio albums. Following a musical sabbatical, Mendes's fifth studio album [[Shawn (album)|''Shawn'']] was released in November 2024 to positive reviews from critics. It explored the [[folk music|folk]] genre and was less commercially successful than its predecessors.

Among [[List of awards and nominations received by Shawn Mendes|his accolades]], Mendes has won 13 [[Society of Composers, Authors and Music Publishers of Canada|SOCAN]] awards, 10 [[MTV Europe Music Award]]s, eight [[Juno Award]]s, eight [[iHeartRadio MMVAs]], two [[American Music Awards]], and received three nominations for a [[Grammy Award]] and one nomination for a [[Brit Award]]. In 2018, ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' named him one of the 100 most influential people in the world on their [[Time 100|annual list]].
